context:
List of Old World monkey species
Scientific name | Common name | Classified | Conservation status
--- | --- | --- | ---
Pygathrix nemaeus | red-shanked douc | 1771 Linnaeus | endangered
Pygathrix nigripes | black-shanked douc | 1871 Milne-Edwards | endangered
Pygathrix cinerea | gray-shanked douc | 1997 Nadler | critically endangered
Rhinopithecus roxellana | golden snub-nosed monkey | 1870 Milne-Edwards | endangered
Rhinopithecus bieti | black snub-nosed monkey | 1897 Milne-Edwards | endangered
Rhinopithecus brelichi | gray snub-nosed monkey | 1903 Thomas | endangered
Rhinopithecus avunculus | Tonkin snub-nosed langur | 1912 Dollman | critically endangered
Nasalis larvatus | proboscis monkey | 1787 Wurmb | endangered
Simias concolor | pig-tailed langur | 1903 Miller | critically endangered

wiki_section_title: Extant species -- Subfamily : Colobinae

wiki_section_text: 

intro: Old World monkeys are all simian primates. They are more closely related to the apes than they are to the New World monkeys.

qa.question: What is the scientific name of the monkey species that was classified by the person who was born on 23 October 1800 ?
